Types.Name: a rainforest
Types.Description: A dense forest in a region with high annual rainfall, noted for its layers of rich ecosystem and biodiversity.

Types.Name: a plant
Types.Description: Organisms that perform photosynthesis and are typically green.

Types.Name: an animal
Types.Description: A living organism characterized by voluntary movement, consumption of organic matter, and sensory organs.

Types.Name: a massive tree
Types.Description: Very large and tall trees that stand out in the forest environment.

Types.Name: a canopy
Types.Description: The upper layer of the forest formed by the crowns of tall trees, blocking much sunlight.

Types.Name: the forest floor
Types.Description: The bottom layer of the forest, below the canopy, often sparsely lit and damp.

Types.Name: a smaller tree
Types.Description: Less tall trees that often grow below the forest canopy.

Types.Name: a bird
Types.Description: Warm-blooded, egg-laying, feathered vertebrates with wings.

Types.Name: a mammal
Types.Description: Warm-blooded vertebrates with hair or fur, most of whom nurture their young with milk.

Types.Name: a fig tree
Types.Description: A genus of about 850 species of woody trees, shrubs, vines, epiphytes, and hemiepiphytes in the family Moraceae.

Types.Name: an ant
Types.Description: Social insects known for their structured colonies or nests and ability to lift materials many times their body weight.

Types.Name: an acacia tree
Types.Description: Trees and shrubs with compound pinnate leaves and clustered flowers, often with thorns.
